div.p: The Jewish mourner's prayer, which must be said three times a day (morning, afternoon, evening) in a synagogue for eleven months following the date of a person's death. For these purposes, the family must hire somebody, perhaps the sexton (shammes) of the synagogue concerned, to whom a fee is payable, to fulfill this obligation.

Arrangements for the kaddish to be said in Marienbad for Schenker's mother, Julia Schenker, who died on December 22, 1917, are extensively discussed in Schenker's diary for January 1918 and thereafter, the agreed amount being 50 Kronen a quarter, or 200 Kronen in total.
